alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Shasta Lake Area, Northern Shasta County; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 04 at 6:37AM PDT until April 04 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 29 to 36 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Areas below 2000 feet including Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County, Northern and Central Sacramento Valley, Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County and Northeast Foothills. * WHEN...Through 9 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lingering breezy conditions along the western Sacramento Valley may moderate temperatures this morning there, but wind-sheltered areas could still see frost. Elsewhere, cold temperatures this morning will allow for area of frost. Cold morning lows are also forecast for Wednesday morning but not as cold as Tuesday.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
